Explanations about Options.-c:
extract files to stdout/screen (``CRT''). This option is similar to the -p option
 except that the name of each file is printed as it is extracted, the -a option is
 allowed, and ASCII-EBCDIC conversion is automatically performed if appropriate.
 This option is not listed in the unzip usage screen.

Top-3 Similar Questions: au_868584: Extract specific Z file method
Top-3 Scripts:
au_868584: cat > /tmp/extract.sh <<'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
for x in "$@"; do
  uncompress -f "${x}"
  rm -f "${x}"
done
EOF
chmod 755 /tmp/extract.sh

Explanations about Options.-name:
This option is supported, but POSIX conformance depends on the POSIX conformance of
 the system's fnmatch(3) library function. As of findutils-4.2.2, shell
 metacharacters (`*', `?' or `[]' for example) will match a leading `.', because
 IEEE PASC interpretation 126 requires this. This is a change from previous
 versions of findutils.
